statement.tex: \text{Write the degree of the differential equation}\\ \qquad x^3\cdot\left(\frac{d^2 y}{dx^2}\right)^2+x\cdot \left(\frac{dy}{dx}\right)^4 = 0

\\ \textbf{Order and degree of a differential equation.}\\ \text{Which one of A,B,C or D (see below) is the }\\ \underline{\text{order}}\text{ of the equation and which is the } \underline{\text{degree}}? \\ x^{\overbrace{3}^A}\cdot \left(\frac{d^{\overbrace{2}^B} y}{dx^2}\right)^{\overbrace{2}^C} +x\cdot \left(\frac{dy}{dx}\right)^{\overbrace{4}^D} = 0

\\ \textbf{Bonus question}\\ \text{What is the order and degree of the following?} \\ \quad \left(\frac{d^2 y}{dx^2}\right)^3 + x\cdot \left(\frac{d^2 y}{dx^2}\right) + \left(\frac{d^3 y}{dx^3}\right) = 0

reason.tex: \begin{tabular}{|c|l|} \hline & \text{Definition} \\ \hline \text{Order} & \text{Find all }\left(\frac{d^N y}{dx^N}\right)\text{ terms }(N\geq 1) \\ &\text{The }\underline{\text{maximum}}\text{ N is the order.} \\ \hline \textbf{Degree} & \text{The }\underline{\text{highest}}\text{ power to which} \\ & \text{the highest order term is raised.} \\ \hline \end{tabular} \\ \text{Hence, we can from }\left(\frac{d^{\overbrace{2}^B} y}{dx^2}\right)^{\overbrace{2}^C} \text{that }\\ \begin{align} \text{Order } &= B = 2 \\ \textbf{Degree} &= C = 2 \end{align}
